Package Main.Consoles

Class CustomPanel

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
javax.swing.JComponent
javax.swing.JPanel
Main.Consoles.CustomPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class CustomPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
Public class CustomPanel is used customise the levels based on the player choice such as level type, number of balls, number of rows of bricks, number of bricks in a row, number of brick types and brick types that spawn.
Since:
28/11/2021
Version:
1.0
Author:
TanZhunXian
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    CustomPanel()
    This constructor is used to generate all the JComboBoxes, JButtons and JLabels on the CustomPanel for the player to customise the levels.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void actionPerformed​(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
    This action listener tracks all actions performed in the CustomPanel such as JComboBoxes use and JButton presses and loads the relevant responses.
    private void brickFalse()
    The brick types are all disabled and are not available for selection.
    int[][] getChoice()
    This method returns the player choices as a double array of integers.
    private void initialize()
    This method sets the CustomPanel background to white and sets the layout to GridLayout.
    private javax.swing.JComboBox<java.lang.String> makeComboBox​(java.lang.String[] choice)
    This method is used to make JComboBoxes with the given array of strings as their options.
    private javax.swing.JButton makeJButton​(java.lang.String label)
    This method is used to make JButtons with the given string as their label.
    private void makeJLabels​(java.lang.String label)
    This method is used to make JLabels with the given string as their label and adds it to the CustomPanel.
    private javax.swing.JLabel makeLabels​(java.lang.String label)
    This method is used to make JLabels with the given string as their label which will change according to the choices by the player.
    private void manageBrick()
    The JComboBox brick types available for selection are reset every time the number of brick types is changed.
    void resetMessage()
    The message showing the player level and level type is reset every time a new level is selected in the JComboBox or when the player saves the current choices.
    void setIndex()
    The choices made by a player for a specific level are loaded into the JComboBoxes every time that level is selected in the JComboBox.

      private javax.swing.JLabel makeLabels​(java.lang.String label)
      This method is used to make JLabels with the given string as their label which will change according to the choices by the player.

      Returns:

      public int[][] getChoice()
      This method returns the player choices as a double array of integers.
      Returns:
      The player choices as a double array of integers is returned.

    • manageBrick

      private void manageBrick()
      The JComboBox brick types available for selection are reset every time the number of brick types is changed.

    • brickFalse

      private void brickFalse()
      The brick types are all disabled and are not available for selection.

    • setIndex

      public void setIndex()
      The choices made by a player for a specific level are loaded into the JComboBoxes every time that level is selected in the JComboBox.

    • resetMessage

      public void resetMessage()
      The message showing the player level and level type is reset every time a new level is selected in the JComboBox or when the player saves the current choices.
